不確定性(Uncertainty)

microeconomics

Analyzing how individuals make decisions about what goods and services to purchase based on preferences and constraints

Author

Anthony Sung

Published

April 10, 2024

Axioms of Uncertainty

When we discuss the uncertainty of

  1. Completeness: For any two lotteries, \(G\) and \(G'\), either \(G \succeq G'\) or \(G' \succeq G\).

  2. Transitivity: …

  3. Continuity: For all \(G \in \mathcal{G}\), there exists \(p_{G}\) such that \((G, 1) \sim (c_{1}, p_{G}; c{N}, 1 - p_{G})\).

  4. Independence: For any \(G\), \(G'\) and \(G'' \in \mathcal{G}\) and any \(\beta \in (0, 1)\), \(G \succeq G'\) if and only if \((G, \beta; G'', 1 - \beta) \succeq (G', \beta; G'', 1 - \beta)\).

  5. Reduction: For any compound lottery, \(G = (L_{1}, \alpha_{1}; L_{2}, \alpha_{2}; \cdots, L_{k}, \alpha_{k})\) \[ G \sim \left(c_{1}, \sum_{k = 1}^{K}\alpha_{k}p_{1}^{k}; \cdots; c_{N}, \sum_{k = 1}^{K}\alpha_{k}p_{N}^{k}\right) \]

\(\textbf{Proposition}\,\text{[Monotonicity]}\) Suppose \(c \succeq c'\), then \((c, p; c', 1 -p) \succeq (c, q; c', 1 - q)\) if and only if \(p \geq q\).

簡言之，如果已知 \(c\) 的結果比 \(c'\) 好，而且有更高的機率會選擇 \(c\)，那麼 $(c, p; c’, 1 -p) $ 會偏好於 \((c, q; c', 1 - q)\)。

\(\textbf{Definition}\): The utility function \(U: \mathcal{G} \to \mathbb{R}\) has an expected utility form if there exists \(u: C \to \mathbb{R}\) such that \[ U(G) = \sum_{i = 1}^{N}p_{i}u(c_{i}) \] where \((p_{n}, c_{n})_{n=1}^{N}\)is the lottery induced by G. A utility function \(U\) with expected utility form is called a von Neumann-Morgenstern (vNM) expected utility function.

\(\textbf{Theorem}\): The following two conditions are equivalent 1. \(\succeq\) satisfies Axiom 1 to 5. 2 There exist a vMN expected utility function U that represents \(\succeq\).
